page_analysis.text_content:
Driveway standards

• Driveway surfaces may have either
permeable or impermeable paving.
Materials shall meet Public Works
standards.

• Driveway surface within 10' of the
public right-of-way may not be of a
loose material e.g., gravel.

• 2nd dwelling units must share com-
mon driveway with main dwelling.

• Minimum driveway clearance: 10'
• Minimum driveway surface: 8'
• Minimum 20' between curb cuts.
• No more than 40% of required
front yard may be impermeable.
• Street-work permit required for
work done within the public right-
of-way.

For safety reasons, the city also encourages
that the following standard be met:

• No more than one curb cut per single
frontage.

• Minimum of 50' between curb cut and
intersection curb face.

Fig 31 Driveway standards

Pavers without mortar
(grass between) OK

"Hollywood strips"
(grass between) OK

Gravel OK

10'
min

Turns enroute to required
parking spaces must be
deemed maneuverable by
the Transportation Division.

8' min. width for driveway
surface (typ. all)

10' min. width for driveway
clearance (typ. all)

No gravel or similar loose
materials within 10' of the
public right-of-way (lot line)

Work done within the public
ROW requires a street-work
permit and must comply with
city standards.

36

visual_elements.description:
Three cross-sectional diagrams illustrating different types of driveway surfaces and their compliance with standards. From left to right:
1. 'Pavers without mortar (grass between) OK': Shows a cross-section of pavers with grass growing in between, indicating it's an acceptable permeable surface.
2. '"Hollywood strips" (grass between) OK': Shows a cross-section of two parallel strips of paving with grass in between, also indicating an acceptable permeable surface.
3. 'Gravel OK': Shows a cross-section of a gravel driveway. This diagram also includes detailed annotations for various dimensions and requirements:
    - A curved section at the top right, labeled with an arrow pointing to text: 'Turns enroute to required parking spaces must be deemed maneuverable by the Transportation Division.'
    - A horizontal line with an arrow pointing to text: '8' min. width for driveway surface (typ. all)'
    - A horizontal line with an arrow pointing to text: '10' min. width for driveway clearance (typ. all)'
    - A vertical dimension line labeled '10' min' indicating a minimum depth or clearance.
    - An arrow pointing to the gravel layer with text: 'No gravel or similar loose materials within 10' of the public right-of-way (lot line)'
    - An arrow pointing to the base layer and extending to the right with text: 'Work done within the public ROW requires a street-work permit and must comply with city standards.'
All three diagrams show a base layer beneath the surface material and a representation of the ground/sub-base.

technical_specifications.parameter: Maximum curb cuts per single frontage
Minimum distance between curb cut and intersection curb face
Maximum distance for loose materials from public right-of-way (lot line)

additional_notes: Page number '36' is present at the bottom left corner.
The text 'manueverable' in the diagram annotation is likely a typo and should be 'maneuverable'.
